headline.main: The Waste of Croton--Stopping the Leaks.
HAYTI.; Business and Health of the Island-Death of the British Consul-Plantations-Habits, &c. &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Business at present is very dull at Port-au-Prince, and most of the Houses are probably sinking money. The market is overstocked with all kinds of goods, and almost every day there are fresh arrivals. When I arrived here last winter the doubloon was worth only 222, (Haytian currency,) and stood at that and 224 for some time It is now worth 252, and bids fair to touch 300 before the year is out.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The morning opened bright and beautful, with a cool breeze. The streets, which before were well filled, are now absolutely thronged with visitors, and the enthusiasm is hourly increasing. The extra trains on each line of rail road come in filled to overflowing.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Chester (Pa.) Republican. Two of your subscribers being on a visit to Washington last week, and being good Whigs, of course felt in duty bound to pay their respects to the Whig nominee for the Presidency--the gallant General Scott, whom they found at his office, in the War Department.

headline.main: THE WATERING PLACES.; Saratoga Springs-The Season-The Waters, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Saratoga has seldom been more completely filled with visitors, generally from a distance, than at present. The crowd, perhaps, is not uncomfortable as, in past seasons, it may have been for a day or two. But the hotels--of which, by the way, there is a larger number than we expected to find--are all very full, and the principal ones are colonizing in the neighboring cottages, dwelling houses,

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: GERMANY.; Antiquities--Gambling at Wiesbaden--Life at the Watering Places.

docs.lead_paragraph: It may be an effect of the waters, but more probably results from a surfeit of guide books and curiosity-hunting, that I am afflicted this morning with an archeological attack. There is no cure for it but letting an historical paragraph. Fastidious readers need not be alarmed-it will be all over in less than half a column.
